content.description: Stand start with a good left-hand crimp and bad right-hand sloper. Work through slopers to the top out.
content.location: To the right of Barefoot, on the rounded arete of the boulder.

content.description: This is the easiest line on the boulder, it doubles as the down-climb. Locate the North face of the boulder and climb the middle of the face to the top fallowing the path of least resistance.
content.protection: at least one pad and spotter, the boulder is quite high
content.location:
Middle of the North face 

  The down climb is easy because you jump from half way down.

content.description:
This is a huge boulder on a dirt pedestal that is rising from the top of a ridge about 200' from the road at the main entrance of the boulder gardens. 

  It is windy and sunny all day 

  The rock quality varies from good to choss depending on the part of the boulder. 

  Since it is in the main area(near Johnny Boulder) you may meet some hikers/climbers.
